author: Jessica Schladebeck
title: Alex Jones apologizes for role in perpetuating ‘Pizzagate'
text:
Infowars founder Alex Jones apologizes for role in perpetuating ‘Pizzagate’ conspiracy theory Alex Jones apologizes for role in perpetuating ‘Pizzagate' NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Saturday, March 25, 2017, 3:56 PM 
Founder of Infowars and conspiracy-peddling media personality Alex Jones apologized for his role in spreading the baseless viral theory that claimed Hillary Clinton and other Democratic leaders were involved in a child sex trafficking ring run out of a Washington, D.C., pizzeria. 
Jones on Friday shared a six-minute video on his website in which he distanced himself from the “Pizzagate” theory that emerged after Wikileaks dumped the emails of Clinton Campaign chair John Podesta. 
The story, he said, “was based upon what we now believe was an incorrect narrative.” 
He repeatedly apologized to James Alefantis, who owned the Comet Ping Pong implicated in the sex ring allegations. Jones did not however, offer any apologies to Clinton, Podesta or their campaign. Alex Jones apologized Friday for Infowars' role in spreading "Pizzagate." (via youtube/The Alex Jones Channel) 
“I made comments about Mr. Alefantis that in hindsight I regret, and for which I apologize to him,” he said, reading from a written statement. “We relied on third-party accounts of alleged activities and conduct at the restaurant. We also relied on accounts of reporters who are no longer with us.” 
He continued: “To my knowledge today, neither Mr. Alefantis nor his restaurant Comet Ping Pong, were involved in any human trafficking as was part of the theories ...” 
The Pizzagate conspiracy theory was thrust into national headlines when Edgar Maddison Welch in December entered Comet Ping Pong armed with an assault rifle. His intention was to “self-investigate” the sex trafficking ring he believed was operating under top Democratic leaders. A fake news story prompted a man to fire a rifle inside a popular Washington, D.C., pizza place as he attempted to "self-investigate" a conspiracy theory that Hillary Clinton was running a child sex ring from there. (Jose Luis Magana/AP) 
Alex Jones praised as 'a hero' by pro-Putin commentator 
Jones said Infowars has removed “the majority of broadcasts and videos” that reference Pizzagate and asked for the forgiveness of the site’s viewers. 
“I want our viewers and listeners to know that we regret any negative impact our commentaries may have had on Mr. Alefantis, Comet Ping Pong or its employees,” he said. “We apologize to the extent our commentaries could be considered as negative statements about Mr. Alefantis or Comet Ping Pong, and we hope that anyone else involved in commenting on Pizzagate will do the same.” Tags:
